articles.title: Yellowstone volcano: Drilling experiment triggered a 'violent eruption' of scorching steam - Daily Express
articles.description: YELLOWSTONE scientists drilling into the volatile supervolcano in the 1960s triggered an unexpected 'violent eruption' caused by scorching water mixing with steam underground.

articles.title: Sweet surprise: Look inside Mars reveals the Red Planet's crust resembles a three-layer cake - Daily Mail
articles.description: InSight's seismometer, SEIS, has recorded over 480 marsquakes. Analyzing seismic waves from these quakes indicates Mars has a three-tier crust that's  about 23 miles thick.

Data beamed back to Earth from NASA's InSight lander suggests Mars' crust is composed of three cake-like layers.
